data.title: What is Blackboard?
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
Overview: Blackboard is the Learning Management System in use within the School District of Waukesha.  As more digital resources are used by students in the classroom, Blackboard is particularly well suited at organizing that content to make it meaningful and easily accessible for users. Blackboard is an incredibly versatile tool that can be used for for posting assignments and information for student/parent access, organizing professional resources, for sharing lesson plans or assessments, for offering self-paced professional development, for communicating key information to an entire staff, or , or for running a face-to-face, hybrid, or virtual classroom. There are several different types of login, based on your role: student, parent/guardian, teacher. The login information below will outline how to properly log into Blackboard. ## Login: Blackboard can be accessed [here](http://bb9.waukesha.k12.wi.us/) Blackboard Support Site: [www.support.blackboard.com](http://www.support.blackboard.com/) ## Student Login Information: Students will use their Domain Login to log on to Blackboard. > Username:  First part of district email address (everything prior to the @ sign). > > > > > ** Example** > >  Staff Member: John Testaccount >            Email Address: [jtestacc000@waukesha.k12.wi.us](mailto:jtestacc000@waukesha.k12.wi.us) >            Domain Username:  jtestacc000 > > Password:  Same as your Domain Login Password

## Parent/Guardian Login to Blackboard As soon as students have been enrolled into a Blackboard course by the teacher of that course, the student's parents/guardians are also automatically enrolled into that course. Parents are issued a Blackboard login.  Provided a parent/guardian has access to all of his/her children with a single Infinite Campus Portal login, the parent/guardian will also be able to observe all of his/her children in Blackboard. The process for switching which child the parent is observing in Blackboard is outlined [here](https://docs.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/document/d/1YDDrBV1Aq3LX7JbcAwOqBt9YCncRJw1YnLFrDy14eVo/edit). In the event that a parent/guardian cannot see all of his/her children, or in the event that a parent/guardian is not aware of his/her Infinite Campus Portal login information, they should contact the building secretary for the school the child attends. ## Finding your Blackboard Parent/Guardian Login Information [!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1413843655021/technology-help/blackboard/IC%20BB%20Account%20Info.png?height=320&width=160\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/blackboard/IC%20BB%20Account%20Info.png?attredirects=0) ## To find your Blackboard Parent login username and password: 1\. You must first login to your the Infinite Campus Portal account\. [Click here for directions](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/infinite-campus#TOC-Creating-an-Account:) 2\. Once in Infinite Campus you will find the Blackboard link menu in the lower left hand corner\.















3\. Click that Blackboard link and you will be taken to a status page where you will see your BB login info\. 4\. Note your username and password shown in area 1 5\. Click the link shown in area 2 to reach the Blackboard login page where you can login\.   [!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1413843953483/technology-help/blackboard/BB%20info%20screen.png?height=108&width=320\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/blackboard/BB%20info%20screen.png?attredirects=0)6\. Once logged in you can switch students to view by following these [directions](https://docs.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/document/d/1YDDrBV1Aq3LX7JbcAwOqBt9YCncRJw1YnLFrDy14eVo/edit). ## Blackboard Mobile App: ![](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1523305663178/technology-help/blackboard/blackboard%20mobile.png) With the [Blackboard mobile app](https://help.blackboard.com/Blackboard_App/Quick_Start) from the app store you can access you SDW blackboard account. If you do not already have the mobile app, download it from the app store (or Self Service if a student iPad) and follow the steps below to login.
*Note, Blackboard has adopted a new mobile app. The app icon at left is the most updated version of the Blackboard Mobile app. If you are using an older version of the Blackboard app, delete it and install this app. The old app is no longer supported. You will not lose work stored in Blackboard when deleting the old Blackboard Mobile app.*



Here is the process to sign into the app.
** Step 1: **At the app startup screen search for Waukesha. Select ***Waukesha School District***. ![](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1523295809923/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0262.PNG?height=240&width=320)




**Step 2: **Enter your username and password. Click ***Log In**.* [!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1523295803783/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0264.PNG?height=240&width=320\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0264.PNG?attredirects=0)
If you already have the mobile app installed on your device and you are unable to connect to the server you may need to logout and perform another search to get the correct server address. To log out of the Blackboard mobile app:
**Step 1: **Click the *three bars icon* in the far upper left. Click ***Settings*** in the menu at left. [!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1523296151032/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0265.PNG?height=240&width=320\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0265.PNG?attredirects=0)
**Step 2:** Click ***Log Out***. [!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1523296160459/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0266.PNG?height=240&width=320\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0266.PNG?attredirects=0)
**Step 3:** Click ***Log Out*** again to confirm that you wish to log out. [!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1523296153458/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0267.PNG?height=240&width=320\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/blackboard/IMG_0267.PNG?attredirects=0) ## BB9 on Mobile Devices: This [document ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bFlFW5AVLSQDIqZcBDWnFJPIv0ZVuxRjnuv6xZfxROw/edit)describes user interface changes to the Black Board user interface on mobile devices. ## Supported Browsers: Current supported browsers for blackboard are found [here](https://help.blackboard.com/en-us/Learn/9.1_SP_12_and_SP_13/Student/030_Browser_Support)

data.title: How do I export my data from Google?
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
# How Do I Export My Data From Google? *Overview:* Google Apps for Education is used for email messaging and collaboration between students and staff at SDW. Not finding what you need? There is more information on the [Google Apps for Students site](https://sites.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/sdw-google-apps-information/) The necessary forms for student use can be found [here](https://sites.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/sdw-google-apps-information/) ## Login: Staff and students can login using the regular gmail login page [www.gmail.com](http://www.gmail.com/). * Student accounts have the format [username@stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us](mailto:username@stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us) Students have a specific login page here [https://www.google.com/a/stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us/](https://www.google.com/a/stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us/) These pages do not require the user to provide the full email address only the username. ## Program Information: The [SDW Google Apps Information Site](https://sites.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/sdw-google-apps-information/) has information about the program. ## Exporting Data from Google: If you are leaving the district (graduating, moving to a new school district, etc.), we encourage you to take your Google data with you. This process will need to be managed by each individual user while your district provided Google account is still active. The account will be eventually suspended and deleted. ### Google Transfer: Google now allows you to "transfer" the files you own to a personal Gmail account. Just a reminder that a personal Gmail Account does not have unlimited data. Your Google apps will be fine as they don't count against your storage, but if you have a large number of other document types in your Google Drive you may not have space for all of them in your personal account. If you do not already have a personal Gmail account you will need to create that first. This can be done at gmail.com. Then follow the directions at this site to complete the transfer: [https://takeout.google.com/transfer?pli=1](https://takeout.google.com/transfer?pli=1) Read more about it here: [https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/6386856](https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/6386856) ### Exporting Docs (and most types of Google Data): Use[ Google Takeou](https://www.google.com/takeout/?pli=1)t to export ALL of your Docs in whatever format you choose, or just export the ones you want right from your Docs. If you're a staff member and would like to transfer the ownership of all of your Docs to a colleague, please contact [ithelpdesk@waukesha.k12.wi.us](mailto:ithelpdesk@waukesha.k12.wi.us) with this request. #### Using Google Takeout to Export Data Your other option (new as of 2018) is to allow Google to do a transfer of your Drive and Gmail files for you. This is achieved by visiting [Google Takeout Transfer](https://takeout.google.com/transfer).
#### Transfer Google Drive Files to Personal Account ### Transferring Site Ownership:  Create a Gmail account and make [yourself@gmail.com](mailto:yourself@gmail.com) .  Then you'll need to make your new personal account the owner of the site by following the directions below. To control who can access your site: 1. Click **More Actions** in the upper right corner of the page. 2. Click **Manage Site**. 3. Open the **Sharing** tab, and enter the email addresses for the people with whom you'd like to share your site. 4. Choose the level of permissions for each person (Owner, Collaborator, Viewer). 5. Click **invite these people**. If you have ever shared a site hosted outside of **@my-domain.com** with your Google Apps account, you'll need to visit[sites.google.com/site/sites/](http://sites.google.com/site/sites/) to access them. (You may not find it under **My Sites** when you go to [https://sites.google.com](https://sites.google.com/)). ### Exporting Calendars: [Export your calendar data](http://www.google.com/support/calendar/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=37111), and import it into your new account (or into iCal, Outlook, etc.) ### Email Contacts and Messages:  Let your contacts know your @waukesha.k12.wi.us address will no longer work (a vacation responder, available in settings, may help with this).  Forward any mail messages you wish to maintain to another email account. ### Exporting Contacts: [Export your contacts](http://mail.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=24911) or use Google Takeout ## Google Calendar: Calendar is used to schedule appointments, maintain a personal, professional, classroom, or building calendar, or to organize group work. For users who would like help with Calendar, here is a helpful guide:  [https://docs.google.com/open?id=0B4AuhEa2OnNhekN5VF9uNTZTeXFWR0ZESHhUTlRhUQ](https://docs.google.com/open?id=0B4AuhEa2OnNhekN5VF9uNTZTeXFWR0ZESHhUTlRhUQ)

data.title: My Google Chrome is Broken
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
# Help! My Google Chrome is Broken! *Overview*: Chrome is a web broswer that is created by Google.  It is optimized and the preferred browser to use for Google Apps. ## Login: This [document](http://support.google.com/chrome/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=185277) describes how to sign in to chrome ## Documentation: The chrome user documentation is located [here](https://support.google.com/chrome/?hl=en#topic=1693469) ## Clearing Browser Cache:  This [document](http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser%27s-Cache) describes how to clear browser cache on several different browsers. ## Sync Errors: This [document](https://support.google.com/chrome/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=1181420&p=settings_sync_error) has some guidance to help resolve sync issues.
If you see a message box like the one below and have recently changed your password you will need to provide your old password to get sync back working again. [!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1404335168594/technology-help/google/chrome/Sign%20in%20-%20Google%20Chrome_2013-03-07_08-21-13.png\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/google/chrome/Sign%20in%20-%20Google%20Chrome_2013-03-07_08-21-13.png?attredirects=0)

data.title: How do I login to Gmail?
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
# How do I login to Gmail?

*Overview:* Google Apps for Education is used for email messaging and collaboration between students and staff at SDW. This page deals with student Gmail issues specifically.  More information is available on the [google apps page](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/google) ## Forms: [Website with family information](http://sites.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/sdw-google-apps-information/formsandguides) ## Login: Staff and students can login using the regular gmail login page [www.gmail.com](http://www.gmail.com/). Student accounts have the format [username@stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us](mailto:username@stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us) Students have a specific login page here [https://www.google.com/a/stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us/](https://www.google.com/a/stu.waukesha.k12.wi.us/) This page does not require the user to provide the full email address only the username. This [document](https://docs.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/file/d/0B0S7LWoPTvsxempPUDVUTG9wNGs/edit) describes the different login boxes and what they look like.

data.title: What is Safe Search?
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
# What is Safe Search?

*Overview:*
Google Safe Search blocks offensive content in Google searches.

## Enabling Safe Search:

By default safe search is enabled for all computers using the chrome browser that are logged in to the waukesha staff and student domains.

## Reporting Offensive Content:
This link is used to report URL's of offensive content that should be filtered by safe search.
[https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/safesearch?pli=1](https://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/safesearch?pli=1)

data.title: Infinite Campus (IC) FAQ
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
# Infinite Campus (IC) FAQ

### Where do I look for detailed grade information?

You can find detailed grade information in Infinite Campus by clicking on the course name hyper link.  This can be found in the Grades Tab or the Schedule Tab.  Remember to consult with your child's teacher if you have specific questions about the grades that have been assigned.

[!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1413223246384/technology-help/infinite-campus/infinite-campus-faq/Campus%20Portal%20-%20Google%20Chrome_2014-10-13_12-59-19.png\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/infinite-campus/infinite-campus-faq/Campus%20Portal%20-%20Google%20Chrome_2014-10-13_12-59-19.png?attredirects=0)
This video may help provide you with more information.

## I can't remember my password what should I do?

You can request a password reset using the link under the help menu (show below).  If you forgot your password before you [setup the rescue email](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/infinite-campus/infinite-campus-faq#TOC-Campus-is-asking-me-for-likes-and-dislikes-why-) you can request a password reset by emailing [IChelp@waukesha.k12.wi.us](mailto:IChelp@waukesha.k12.wi.us).

[!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1408806495165/technology-help/infinite-campus/infinite-campus-faq/Campus%20Parent%20Portal%20Login.png\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/infinite-campus/infinite-campus-faq/Campus%20Parent%20Portal%20Login.png?attredirects=0)

## Should I let my child use my family campus account?

No!  Your child should not be using a parent/guardian account. A parent account has the ability to see all children in the family and perform tasks like payment of fees.  Each child should use their own student account.  Students can login to the portal using their district username and password.  This is the same username and password used to login to a computer at school.   That will give them the correct permissions to perform tasks that they need to do.

## What is Campus Student?

An exciting new feature for students in the School District of Waukesha to use along side the Campus Portal.  For more info please consult the this [Campus Student Guide](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MRzs51mqGoVqKM8LiFZ_uEL8btJ8RzL0uNweFJhNMEk/edit#heading=h.sowk9r99q1al) for more information.

## I am installing the app, where can I find the Site ID?

You need to have a valid campus account and the valid Site ID is currently YNJJFW.

## I have my Activation Key where do I put it in?

The activation key is used under the help menu on the login screen.  Consult the [activation guide](https://docs.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/file/d/0B_j6nKUvJ4MDWElacGdqRjhTQXc/edit) or the [*help video \(**YT: SDW IC Parent Portal Account Creation**\)*](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D-dPmZQ8WjM#t=14)
![](chrome-extension://ddpephnhacfpgcemhioaejgenlgadnnh/icons/embed.svg)
 for more information.
[!\[\]\(http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/_/rsrc/1407939917173/technology-help/infinite-campus/infinite-campus-faq/campushelpscreen.png\)](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/infinite-campus/infinite-campus-faq/campushelpscreen.png?attredirects=0)

## Someone told me I can find Blackboard login info in IC.  Where is it?

This [article](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/technology-help/blackboard#TOC-To-find-your-Blackboard-Parent-login-username-and-password:) describes how to find blackboard information.

## What is the Tech Info Page?

The Tech Info page is a custom page in the IC Parent Portal that describes information about your students district issued technology.  You can use this page to see an app inventory of your students devices and  place to securely store username and password information so that you and your students teacher can share it.  The tech info page is described [here](http://sites.google.com/a/waukesha.k12.wi.us/waukesha-one/parent-information/app-inventory).

## Question still not answered?

Submit your question to [IChelp@waukesha.k12.wi.us](mailto:IChelp@waukesha.k12.wi.us) and ask us to answer your question and add it to the website.

data.title: I Broke my iPad
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
# I Broke my iPad *Overview**:* In the School District of Waukesha, iPads are generally treated as self-management devices.  This means that teachers and students are encouraged to take control of the iPad to make it as useful for learning and teaching as they need to.  Many of the resources and tutorials provided here answer some of the most common questions asked.  If additional support is needed, please contact the [IT Help Desk](http://helpdesk.waukesha.k12.wi.us:8081/helpdesk/WebObjects/Helpdesk.woa), submit a ticket, and a member of the Technology Department will be happy to support you. ## Repair Procedure: If an iPad is damaged a repair request can be entered using the [Missing / Damaged iPad](http://w1.waukesha.k12.wi.us/home/report-missing-ipad) form.
## Setting Up Gmail on iPad: In order to get full benefit of Gmail on your iPad (including having district contacts available when using Gmail on the iPad), utilize these instructions to properly set up Gmail on the iPad.

data.title: What Wi-Fi do I use?
data.author: Admin
data.markdown:
# What Wi-Fi do I use?

### What is what?:

Guest wireless via the SDW-GUEST SSID is available for all student and staff personal devices when they are used for instructional related activities.
Use of this network is filtered as required by [CIPA](http://www.fcc.gov/guides/childrens-internet-protection-act).  The usage of this is governed by the district Acceptable Use Policy for staff and students.
Violation of the policy may result in revocation of the privilege to use the guest wireless.

Students and Staff will not be able to connect to the guest wireless using their district owned devices.

## Troubleshooting:

If you open a browser, and it presents you with just a blank page instead of the authentication page where you can enter your credentials, try [clearing your cache and cookies](http://help.waukesha.k12.wi.us/system/errors/NodeNotFound?suri=wuid:gx:d87832af7ed1ff1).
